data.text: @flybyday63 Well, I hope it won’t be too bad. Try to keep your spirits up.
@flybyday63 About the only positive of that I can think of is that you’ll be able to have 24/7 aircon 😂 Being stuck in a room certainly isn’t fun for sure

@OliverBerlau About 48 hours.
This is a 5 day trip as we left London Tuesday evening and we'll land back at LHR Saturday (early morning), so discounting the time we are actually flying, we stay a bit more than 48 hours here in Singapore
@jay_j79 @flybyday63 If you’re a tourist you no longer need to do quarantine, I doubt mask rules will change by the time F1 happens, but group sizes will probably be more than 5 by that point
@jay_j79 I agree, when even Australia is opening up, Singapore still remains super-strict with the Covid restrictions!

@suetay45 We can book slots of up to 2 hours to eat at the hotel restaurant, we can also book to use the hotel gym and only fully vaccinated persons can  use the Outdoor/Lounge facilities. 
Very sad to be in Singapore and not being able to leave the hotel ☹️
@darrencpenn No, we cannot leave the hotel.😔

@flybyday63 Singapore is one country I’m watching.  They are pushing hard in all directions to let everyone know the F1 night race is back on this year to help revive tourism, yet with all the restrictions and hurdles in place, who wants to gamble and book hoping they clear in time?
@flybyday63 Come back to Chennai again. Weather is perfect now and not much restrictions. Plus you would get a couple days to enjoy before the hot summer kicks in.
